Description: Start with mobile layout and enhance for larger screens
Do: Design mobile layout first then add md: lg: xl: breakpoints
Don't: Start with desktop and try to shrink down
Platform Notes: Tailwind: sm:640px md:768px lg:1024px xl:1280px 2xl:1536px

Description: Content should be accessible at any width between breakpoints
Do: Use fluid layouts with max-width containers and percentage widths
Don't: Only test at exact breakpoint values
Platform Notes: Test at 320px (min mobile) to 2560px (4K)

Description: Interactive elements must be large enough for touch on mobile
Do: Minimum 44x44px touch targets on mobile (48x48px preferred)
Don't: Use desktop-sized buttons on mobile without scaling
Platform Notes: Use Tailwind h-11 w-11 minimum for touch

Description: Back/forward buttons should work with app state
Do: Use URL-based routing react-router or Next.js router
Don't: Build SPA that breaks browser navigation
Platform Notes: History API or framework router required

Description: Every view should have a shareable URL
Do: Map routes to UI state use query params for filters
Don't: Store state only in memory or localStorage
Platform Notes: Server-side rendering helps with SEO

Description: Scroll should restore when navigating back
Do: Implement scroll restoration with router or ScrollRestoration
Don't: Always scroll to top on every navigation
Platform Notes: Use scrollRestoration: 'auto' or manual control

Description: Leverage browser validation and accessibility
Do: Use input type=email type=tel type=date for mobile keyboards
Don't: Build custom inputs without accessibility
Platform Notes: Native inputs get free keyboard optimization

Description: Forms should preserve state and show validation
Do: Use react-hook-form or similar debounce validation show inline errors
Don't: Validate only on submit lose state on navigation
Platform Notes: Controlled components with proper state management

Description: Browser password managers and autofill should work
Do: Use proper autocomplete attributes on inputs
Don't: Block or break autofill functionality
Platform Notes: autocomplete=email autocomplete=current-password

Description: Only load what's visible initially
Do: Use dynamic import() for routes and heavy components
Don't: Bundle everything in initial load
Platform Notes: Next.js next/dynamic or React.lazy for code splitting

Description: Images are usually the heaviest assets
Do: Use next/image or srcset responsive images WebP format
Don't: Serve unoptimized full-size images to all devices
Platform Notes: Lazy load images with loading=lazy attribute

Description: Content should not jump as page loads
Do: Reserve space for dynamic content use aspect-ratio
Don't: Load content that shifts existing content
Platform Notes: Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) Core Web Vital

Description: All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
Do: Use semantic HTML test Tab/Enter/Escape flows
Don't: Rely on mouse-only interactions div as buttons
Platform Notes: Focus visible styles required focus-visible:ring

Description: Content should be accessible to screen readers
Do: Use proper heading hierarchy landmarks labels aria-
Don't: Visual-only content without text alternatives
Platform Notes: Test with VoiceOver NVDA ChromeVox

Description: Text must be readable against backgrounds
Do: WCAG AA: 4.5:1 for normal text 3:1 for large text
Don't: Light gray text on white backgrounds
Platform Notes: Use contrast checker tools validate in dark mode too

Description: Gracefully handle network disconnection
Do: Show offline indicator cache critical data retry on reconnect
Don't: Crash or hang when network unavailable
Platform Notes: Service Worker for PWA offline support

Description: Pages should print cleanly when needed
Do: Use @media print to hide nav show content legibly
Don't: Ignore print stylesheets entirely
Platform Notes: Hide navigation modals optimize layout for paper

Description: Honor system and browser settings
Do: Check prefers-reduced-motion prefers-color-scheme
Don't: Ignore accessibility preferences
Platform Notes: CSS media queries for preference detection

Description: These properties are GPU accelerated
Do: Animate transform and opacity avoid layout properties
Don't: Animate width height margin padding top left
Platform Notes: will-change for complex animations

Description: Some users need minimal animation
Do: @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) disable animations
Don't: Force animations on all users
Platform Notes: Tailwind motion-reduce: variant

Description: Modern layout techniques are well supported
Do: Grid for 2D layouts Flexbox for 1D alignment
Don't: Float-based layouts or tables for layout
Platform Notes: Browser support is excellent (97%+)

Description: Components should adapt to container not viewport
Do: Use @container queries for reusable component sizing
Don't: Media queries inside components that depend on page
Platform Notes: container-type: inline-size on parent

Description: Shareable filterable sortable states belong in URL
Do: Put search filters sort order pagination in query params
Don't: Store list state only in React/Vue state
Platform Notes: Use URL search params for list views

Description: Every async action needs loading indication
Do: Show skeleton or spinner during data fetch
Don't: Jump straight from empty to loaded
Platform Notes: React Suspense or manual loading state

Description: Search engines parse HTML structure
Do: Use h1-h6 nav main article section footer
Don't: div soup with no semantic meaning
Platform Notes: One h1 per page proper heading hierarchy

Description: Pages need proper meta for sharing
Do: title description og:image og:title for social sharing
Don't: Generic or missing meta tags
Platform Notes: Next.js Metadata API or react-helmet

Description: Mobile users expect swipe and pinch
Do: Implement swipe to dismiss pull to refresh where expected
Don't: Mouse-only interactions on touch devices
Platform Notes: Touch events or gesture libraries

Description: Buttons should respond immediately
Do: Use touch-action: manipulation on interactive elements
Don't: Default double-tap delay on buttons
Platform Notes: Meta viewport with user-scalable=no if appropriate

Description: Anchor links and scroll-to should animate
Do: Use scroll-behavior: smooth or scrollIntoView with behavior
Don't: Jarring instant scroll jumps
Platform Notes: CSS scroll-behavior or JS scrollIntoView

Description: Headers and sidebars often need to stick
Do: Use position: sticky with proper top/bottom values
Don't: Fixed positioning that breaks scroll flow
Platform Notes: Sticky works within scroll container limits
